document_title: Achilles tendonitis: Causes, symptoms, home treatment
subsection_content:
To limit the risk of Achilles tendonitis, you should note:
Avoid suddenly increasing your activity level: If you have just started an exercise regimen, you should do it slowly, gradually increasing the duration and intensity of the exercise to give your body time to adapt and avoid putting pressure on your heels. ; Do not overexert yourself: You should avoid activities that cause excessive stress to your tendons. If you have to participate in strenuous activities, you need to warm up first to warm up your body, helping your muscles and connective tissue become more flexible when entering the main exercise. During exercise, if you feel pain, you should stop immediately and rest.; Stretch your muscles: You should take time to stretch your leg muscles and tendons every morning before exercising. This will help prevent recurring inflammation, strengthen tendons and muscles, and limit inflammation.; Avoid running on hard or slippery surfaces; Choose clothes suitable for the type of exercise.; Diversify exercises: You can replace high-intensity exercises such as running, climbing stairs, jumping... with low-intensity exercises such as walking, swimming... This will help you limit the condition. increases too much pressure on the Achilles tendon, causing injury; Choose the right shoes: In addition to fitting your feet, training shoes need to provide good support for all foot activities.
In addition, you should replace your training shoes with new ones if they are old or excessively worn.
